evidence: Both the tensile strength and yield strength of all the studied Ti-Ta alloys are much higher than those of pure titanium, and varies between 510 and 690 MPa for the former, and 400 and 610 MPa for the latter. As an example, it can be seen that the tensile strength is 510 MPa at 10% Ta, and increases with increasing Ta content, then decreases after Ta content exceeds 30% and reaches a valley value of 530 MPa at 50% Ta. Afterwards, it increases again and reaches the peak value of 690 MPa at 60% Ta.
